subject: Negotiation
title: Facebook Buys Instagram for $1 Billion
description: Learn Facebook Buys Instagram for $1 Billion in one minute.

hook.text: In 2012, Facebook bought a 13-person company with zero revenue for one billion dollars.

buildup.text: Instagram had 30 million users and was growing fast. Mark Zuckerberg saw it as a future threat.

discovery.text: Zuckerberg contacted Instagram's CEO directly, bypassing boards and bankers entirely.

twist.text: Twitter was also in talks with Instagram â€” Zuckerberg's speed killed the competing offer.

climax.text: Instagram is now worth over $100 billion. The $1B price tag was the deal of the century.

punchline.text: Speed wins when everyone else is still scheduling meetings.

quiz.question: Why did Zuckerberg negotiate directly with Instagram's CEO?
options: Speed and directness beat the competing Twitter offer
